place.name: LLANTHEWY VACH
place.gazetteerText: LLANTHEWY-VACH, a parish in Pontypool district, Monmouth; on an affluent of the river Usk, 2¾ miles E by N of Cwmbran r. station, and 4½ SW of Usk. Posttown, Caerleon, under Newport, Monmouth. Acres, 1,350. Real property, £1,192. Pop., 172. Houses, 33. The property is subdivided. The living is a p. curacy in the diocese of Llandaff. Value, £77. Patron, Jesus College, Oxford. The church is good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
